data.title: Chevron Stock Rises as Earnings Fall but Top Estimates. Here's Why. — Barrons.com
data.description:
By Avi Salzman

Chevron stock has been in a holding pattern, but its third-quarter earnings report on Friday, plus an upcoming investor day, could change the narrative.

The company has achieved several of its goals in 2025, including pumping out more than 1 million barrels of oil per day from the Permian Basin and finalizing a deal to acquire oil producer Hess. Shares are up 6% this year.

Finding a new catalyst to make the stock rise more has been difficult. In the past month, Chevron has been trading flat as oil prices have fluctuated on geopolitical news.

Analysts expect Chevron to post $1.71 of earnings per share in the third quarter, down from $2.51 a year ago. Oil prices have fallen from last year's level — international prices were recently trading at $64 a barrel, down 14% on the year.

One area where Chevron could impress investors is in its nascent power business. The company has said it's working on plans to build power plants that could power AI data centers. Investors will also be watching closely to see if Chevron changes its stock-buyback policy, after the company slowed the pace of buybacks earlier this year. Shareholder returns are one of the main reasons to buy the stock, given the company's 4.4% dividend yield.

Chevron will also hold an investor day on Nov. 12.

"The upcoming strategy day is not set to be an event for unveiling big new financial targets, but does come at an opportune time for Chevron to reinforce its message around operating resilience — including delivering on real growth and free cash flow expansion — even in this more challenging oil macro," wrote Citi analyst Alastair Syme.

Out of the 30 analysts who cover Chevron and are tracked by FactSet, 15 have a Buy rating, 14 have a Hold rating, and 1 has a Sell rating, with an average price target of $169.

Chevron ended Thursday down 1%, closing at $153.52.

Write to Avi Salzman at avi.salzman@barrons.com

This content was created by Barron's, which is operated by Dow Jones & Co. Barron's is published independently from Dow Jones Newswires and The Wall Street Journal.

data.title: Carlyle Credit Incm Fund Expects Net Proceeds (Before Expenses) of About $16.3M >CCIF
Civeo Narrows 2025 View To Rev $640M-$655M >CVEO
Cenovus Energy 3Q Profit Rises On Higher Output
data.description:
By Adriano Marchese

Cenovus Energy profit jumped on the back of strong output in the third quarter.

The Canadian energy company on Friday posted a higher net income of 1.29 billion Canadian dollars ($922.3 million), or C$0.72 a share, up from C$820 million, or C$0.42 a share, in the comparable quarter a year ago.

According to FactSet, analysts were expecting C$0.51 a share.

Adjusted funds flow, a key metric that measures the cash generated by a company's core operations, excluding non-cash items and other one-off items.

Revenue came in at C$13.2 billion, just below analyst expectations of C$13.31 billion. In the third quarter of last year, the company reported revenue of C$14.2 billion.

In its U.S. refining segment, crude throughput came to 605,300 barrels a day. Upstream production reached 832,900 barrels of oil equivalent a day, up from 771,300 a day a year ago, of which about 642,800 a day were from the oil sand segment. Analysts were expecting total production of about 830,500 barrels a day.

Cenovus Energy recently reached a deal to acquire MEG Energy in a strategic move to expand its oil sands portfolio. The agreement included the divestiture of certain assets to Strathcona Resources, which was also in the running to acquire MEG. This proposed transaction, which will finally be voted on by MEG shareholders on Nov. 7, aims to consolidate Cenovus's position in thermal oil production in the competitive landscape of Canadian oil patch.

For the full year, Cenovus lowered its output guidance to reflect the disposal of its 50% stake in WRB Refining LP, a joint venture with Phillips 66. It now expects downstream throughput of 510,000 barrels a day to 515,000 barrels a day, which represents a decrease of 52,500 barrels a day at the midpoint.

Downstream turnaround expenses are now pegged at of $360 million to $380 million, lowered by $65 million at the midpoint.

Write to Adriano Marchese at adriano.marchese@wsj.com

data.title: Magna raises annual sales forecast on vehicle assembly, safety tech demand
data.description:
Magna International raised its annual sales forecast on Friday, as the Canadian auto parts supplier leans on demand for its vehicle assembly business and safety systems.

The results follow peers Aptiv and BorgWarner warning of production snarls from a supply crunch related to Dutch firm Nexperia and a fire at a critical aluminum supplier.

Magna, which counts Ford , General Motors , Stellantis and other European automakers as customers, expects its annual sales to be between $41.1 billion and $42.1 billion, up from its prior range of $40.4 billion to $42.0 billion.

U.S.-listed shares of the company were up about 1% in premarket trade.

Steady demand for advanced driver-aid safety technology and auto parts from automakers ramping up production has helped auto parts suppliers amid the disruptions caused by U.S. tariffs.

Magna, which has factories in North America and Europe, assembles units for automakers at its complete vehicle manufacturing unit.

Its quarterly sales rose 1.7% to $10.5 billion from a year earlier. Analysts on average expected the company to report sales of $10.14 billion, according to data compiled by LSEG.

On an adjusted basis, Magna earned $1.33 per share for the quarter through September, above estimates of $1.21.

data.title: Yomiuri: Hello Kitty to Make Hollywood Debut in 2028
data.description:
By Taihei Ishikawa

Yomiuri Shimbun Staff Writer

Hello Kitty is set to make her Hollywood film debut in 2028.

Sanrio Co., a Japanese character company, announced Thursday that the globally recognized character will be the main character in the movie, which is set to be released worldwide on July 21, 2028.

Sanrio is set to develop the movie with production companies under major U.S. movie company Warner Bros. Entertainment Inc. Multiple Sanrio characters are also expected to appear in the film, which will include such themes as friendship and connection.

The movie's title and details of the story are still being worked on, the company said.

"This marks an exciting new chapter for Sanrio as we step into the world of Hollywood and explore new frontiers in entertainment," Tomokuni Tsuji, president and CEO of Sanrio, said in a statement. "We hope to spread smiles and happiness further afield through this film."

----

This article is from The Yomiuri Shimbun. Neither Dow Jones Newswires, MarketWatch, Barron's nor The Wall Street Journal were involved in the creation of this content.

data.title: Corbus Pharma tumbles on pricing $75 mln stock offering
data.description:
** Shares of Corbus Pharmaceuticals down 14.8% premarket at $14 after follow-on priced

** Norwood, Massachusetts-based oncology and obesity firm early Fri sold ~5.8 mln shares, including ~1 mln p re-funded warrants, for $75 mln gross proceeds

** Offering price of $13 is 20.9% discount to stock's last close

** It intends to use net offering proceeds to fund clinical development of its pipeline and for working capital and other purposes

** Jefferies acting as the bookrunner, per the statement. In the offering prospectus, Jefferies and Piper Sandler were cited as joint bookrunners

** CRBP has ~12.26 mln shares outstanding for about $200 mln market cap

** Through Thurs close, CRBP shares had gained ~77% over the past three months, putting them up 39% YTD

** Earlier this month, co shared early-stage data of CRB-701, its experimental therapy for head and neck cancer that has returned or spread after earlier treatments, at the annual European Society for Medical Oncology

** All 10 analysts covering CRBP are bullish and their median PT is $40, per LSEG data

data.title: Princes Group makes subdued start to trading in London IPO
data.description:
By Charlie Conchie

Princes Group (PRN.L) made a subdued trading debut on Friday after the food producer priced its IPO at the lower end of a marketed range, in a sign of investor caution for one of London's largest listings this year.

Princes' shares rose 1% at the start of trading before reversing course and dropping 1%.

The Liverpool-based owner of Napolina pasta and tinned tuna brand Princes raised around 420 million pounds in the share sale after pricing its shares at 475 pence each, valuing the company at 1.16 billion pounds ($1.56 billion).

The previously announced range was between 475 pence and 590 pence per share.

Princes Group intends to use the proceeds to finance further acquisitions, according to its prospectus.

The IPO is among London’s biggest in recent years and comes amid signs of a revival in activity on London’s markets.

Alternative lender Shawbrook floated at a valuation of 1.9 billion pounds on Thursday, near the middle of its target price range, while cosmetic tech firm Beauty Tech Group floated earlier this month.

Shawbrook shares jumped nearly 7% on their first day of trading, while Beauty Tech shares have lost nearly 6% since listing, according to LSEG data.

Princes Group, which has become one of Europe's biggest grocery suppliers in recent decades through nearly two dozen acquisitions and mergers, is looking to deliver 1 billion to 1.5 billion pounds in incremental revenue growth through acquisitions over the medium term, according to its prospectus.

It was bought by Milan-listed Newlat Food in 2024 for 700 million pounds. Newlat subsequently changed its name to New Princes Group.

Last year Princes Group generated pro forma revenues of 2.1 billion pounds, according to accounts in its prospectus.

($1 = 0.7451 pounds)

data.title: Apple shares rise as iPhone holiday sales forecast soothes supply woes
data.description:
Apple shares rose about 2% premarket on Friday after upbeat forecasts for the lucrative holiday quarter suggested the latest iPhone 17 models were driving a sales rebound despite delays in shipping to key market China.

While the supply constraints weighed on sales in the fourth quarter, investors remained optimistic as the September launch of the new iPhone lineup helped Apple shares cross above $4 trillion in market capitalization earlier this week, joining Nvidia and Microsoft .

The outlook has also helped allay concerns around Apple going slow on the integration of some long-awaited artificial intelligence features even as other tech majors race ahead.

"I just know that owning this stock for many decades ... When you're really big like Apple, you don't have to move fast, sometimes you just have to get it right eventually," said Eric Clark, chief investment officer at Accuvest.

Amazon and Apple shares are still the worst performers for the year so far among the so-called "Magnificent Seven" group of magacaps, though the e-commerce giant's stock soared before the bell on Friday on stellar cloud growth in the quarter.

Apple's stock trades at 33.4 times analysts' profit expectations, representing a premium to Microsoft's 31.7 and Meta Platform's 22.3, according to LSEG data.

data.title: Lear Sees 2025 Core Operating Earnings $995M-$1.06B >LEA
Exxon 3Q Profit Falls, Hurt By Weak Pricing
data.description:
By Connor Hart

Exxon Mobil logged lower profit in the third quarter, hurt by weaker oil prices and higher costs, despite increasing production at two important oil fields.

The oil and gas company on Friday posted a profit of $7.55 billion, or $1.76 a share, compared with $8.61 billion, or $1.92 a share, a year earlier.

Stripping out certain one-time costs, earnings were $1.88 a share. Analysts surveyed by FactSet had expected adjusted earnings of $1.82 a share.

Exxon attributed the lower earnings to weaker crude prices, bottom-of-cycle chemical margins, higher depreciation, growth costs and lower base volumes stemming from divestments.

These headwinds were partially offset by volume growth in the Permian Basin, the largest U.S. oil field, where the company said it set a production record of nearly 1.7 million oil-equivalent barrels per day. At the Exxon-led project in Guyana, quarterly production surpassed 700,000 barrels per day.

Exxon said it sent $9.4 billion to shareholders in dividends and share repurchases.

Write to Connor Hart at connor.hart@wsj.com

data.title: Chevron 3Q Profit Falls on Lower Oil Prices
data.description:
By Nicholas G. Miller

Chevron said its third-quarter profit fell, citing lower crude oil prices and expenses from its acquisition of Hess.

The company posted earnings of $3.54 billion, or $1.82 a share, for the three months ended Sept. 30, down from $4.49 billion, or $2.48 a share, a year earlier.

Chevron logged an adjusted profit of $3.6 billion, or $1.85 a share.

Analysts surveyed by FactSet expected adjusted earnings of $1.71 a share.

The company said it incurred a net loss of $235 million due to severance and other transaction costs related to its acquisition of Hess. Chevron completed its Hess acquisition in July in an all-stock transaction valued at $53 billion.

Meanwhile, sales and other operating revenues slipped to $48.17 billion from $48.93 billion the year before. Analysts had expected $47.23 billion in revenue.

Total upstream earnings declined to $3.3 billion in the third quarter, down from $4.59 billion a year ago, while total downstream earnings rose to $1.14 billion from $595 million, in the year-earlier period.

Oil prices have fallen in recent months largely due to strong supply as the OPEC+ oil cartel has eased production cuts. Prices have also been weighed down this year by concerns of an economic slowdown.

Write to Nicholas G. Miller at nicholas.miller@wsj.com.

data.title: Yomiuri: JERA Intends to Expand Offshore Wind Power Generation Business
data.description:
By Hiroyuki Kume, Tomoko Numajiri and Miho Naganuma / Yomiuri Shimbun Staff Writers

JERA Co., a major Japanese power generation company, expressed its intention to expand its offshore wind power generation business.

Masato Yamada, CEO of the Japan arm of JERA Nex BP Ltd., said that "takeoff is key" for the nation's wind power generation business, during an interview with The Yomiuri Shimbun.

JERA Nex BP is an offshore wind power generation joint venture established by JERA and British energy giant BP PLC.

Yamada talked about JERA's outlook in the wind power generation business. The following is excerpted from his interview.

The Yomiuri Shimbun: What do you think about the current business environment?

Masato Yamada: The depreciation of the yen is the biggest factor affecting Japan, in addition to inflation. The economic situation is extremely tough right now. Europe is also facing hardships, with projects being canceled or delayed one after another as they became unprofitable.

However, Japan's problems extend beyond these issues. We have to start from zero regarding offshore wind power generation, as it's a field we don't have any experience in. We are at the stage of initial investment. We need to prepare everything, from ships to ports.

Costs are going up due to uncertainties and inefficiencies, which stem from a lack of proficiency in the field. Those factors should be distinguished from costs that arise from macroeconomic conditions.

The burden of initial investment needs to be shared in some way. Without doing so, it will be difficult for Japan's wind power generation business to take off. You know, an airplane consumes the most fuel during takeoff. Investment is needed to help the launch of the business.

As I've said, takeoff is key. After that stage, an ecosystem will be formed, so costs can be pushed down. Europe has proven that costs decrease with experience. If we don't start, we will never reach the stage where costs begin to fall. We must overcome this hurdle first.

Competing in global market

Yomiuri: How many years will it take for your vision to be realized?

Yamada: It took Europe 25 years. The world's first offshore wind farm began operating in 1991 in Denmark, and the initial costs were astronomical. During this long journey, wind turbines and ships (used to build and maintain them) have become larger, and construction methods have advanced.

Companies sometimes worked together and sometimes competed against each other, and during this process, they accumulated experience and improved efficiency. Japan lacks large-scale industries involving offshore oil and gas fields, putting the country at a disadvantage in developing offshore projects.

(In Japan), the public bidding for large-scale projects that are set to be built in general waters have turned into a price war. Hurdles have risen dramatically as companies also face pressure to shorten construction time. Preparation time is very short, and data is lacking. Companies must finish construction cheaply and under tight deadlines. It's safe to say that the demands are beyond the capabilities of the companies.

Yomiuri: What are your plans to advance domestic projects?

Yamada: The JERA group has made a strategic decision to team up with British energy giant BP to conduct business globally, based on a decision to continue working on offshore wind power projects.

We will gather experience and knowledge to compete in the global offshore wind market. My mission is to carry out domestic projects with strong business structure and the best possible methods.

----

This article is from The Yomiuri Shimbun. Neither Dow Jones Newswires, MarketWatch, Barron's nor The Wall Street Journal were involved in the creation of this content.

YDN-M0000154548-1

Newell Brands Q3 2025 Financial Results
data.description:
Newell Brands, a leading global consumer goods company, has released its financial results for the third quarter of 2025. The company, known for its portfolio of well-known brands such as Rubbermaid, Sharpie, and Coleman, reported a mixed performance amid challenging market conditions.

Financial Highlights

For the third quarter of 2025, Newell Brands reported net sales of $1.8 billion, a decline of 7.2% compared to the same period last year. The company's gross margin decreased to 34.1% from 34.9% in the prior year period, primarily due to the impact of China tariffs, volume declines, and inflation. Despite these challenges, the company achieved a net income of $21 million, a significant improvement from the net loss of $198 million in the prior year period. Diluted earnings per share (EPS) were $0.05, compared to a diluted loss per share of $0.48 in the previous year.

Business and Operational Highlights

Newell Brands faced reduced retail inventory levels and softness in international markets, particularly in Brazil. However, the company expects its international business to return to growth in the fourth quarter. The Home & Commercial Solutions segment generated net sales of $942 million, while the Learning & Development segment reported net sales of $681 million. The Outdoor & Recreation segment maintained net sales of $183 million, reflecting a slight core sales decline of 0.9%.

Strategic Initiatives and Corporate Developments

The company continued to invest in innovation and brand building, with advertising and promotion expenses at the highest rate in nearly a decade. Newell Brands also focused on improving operational efficiency by deploying advanced AI tools across the organization. The company reduced its debt to $4.8 billion and maintained cash and cash equivalents of $229 million at the end of the third quarter.

Management's Perspective

Chris Peterson, President and CEO of Newell Brands, highlighted the company's strategic measures to mitigate trade disruptions, including sourcing changes, pricing actions, and productivity initiatives. CFO Mark Erceg noted that the company's gross margin would have expanded by 55 basis points if not for the temporary impact of China tariffs. He also emphasized the company's focus on improving efficiency and reducing overhead costs.

Future Outlook

Newell Brands updated its outlook for the full year 2025, expecting net sales to decline by 5.0% to 4.5% and core sales to decline by 5.0% to 4.0%. The company anticipates a normalized operating margin of 8.4% to 8.6% and normalized EPS of $0.56 to $0.60. The company also projected operating cash flow for the full year to be in the range of $250 million to $300 million.

Original SEC Filing: NEWELL BRANDS INC. [ NWL ] - 8-K - Oct. 31, 2025

Disclaimer
This is an AI-powered summary. It may contain inaccuracies. Consider verifying important information with the source. Please note this summary is solely based on documents filed with the SEC.

data.title: Emerald Holding, Inc. Reports Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results
data.description:
Emerald Holding, Inc., America's largest producer of trade shows and their associated conferences, content, and commerce, has released its financial results for the third quarter ended September 30, 2025. The company has shown strong operational execution and remains on track to achieve its full-year objectives, despite some challenges in the third quarter.

Financial Highlights

For the third quarter of 2025, Emerald reported revenues of $77.5 million, marking a 6.7% increase over the prior year period. However, the company experienced a net loss of $14.4 million, compared to a net loss of $11.1 million in the same period last year. Adjusted EBITDA for the quarter was $12.8 million, a slight increase from $12.5 million in the prior year period.

Year-to-date, the company reported revenues of $330.7 million, a 13.3% increase over the prior year period. The net loss for the first nine months of 2025 was $0.5 million, a significant improvement from the $2.9 million net loss in the prior year period. Adjusted EBITDA for the year-to-date period was $90.8 million, up from $68.6 million in the prior year period.

Business and Operational Highlights

Emerald's performance was bolstered by revenues from recent acquisitions, including Generis, This is Beyond, and Insurtech Insights. However, the company faced a decline in Organic Revenues, which decreased by 6.8% in the third quarter. The ongoing construction at the Las Vegas Convention Center and some tariff headwinds impacted the company's largest event in the quarter.

Operationally, Emerald's Board of Directors approved an extension and expansion of the company's share repurchase program, allowing for the repurchase of up to $25.0 million of common stock through December 31, 2026. The company repurchased 116,094 shares for $0.5 million in the third quarter at an average price of $4.87 per share.

Strategic Initiatives and Corporate Developments

Emerald has updated its full-year 2025 guidance to reflect the acquisition of Generis, now expecting revenues in the range of $460–$465 million and Adjusted EBITDA between $122.5–$127.5 million. The company also declared a dividend of $0.015 per share for the quarter ending December 31, 2025, payable on November 20, 2025.

Management's Perspective

Hervé Sedky, Emerald’s President and CEO, emphasized the company's disciplined execution and strategic focus, highlighting the acquisition of Generis and the advancement of innovation initiatives like early-stage AI tools. CFO David Doft noted the solid fundamentals and continued momentum across the portfolio, despite temporary impacts from construction and tariffs.

Future Outlook

Emerald's updated guidance for the full year 2025 reflects confidence in achieving its objectives, with expected revenues of $460–$465 million and Adjusted EBITDA of $122.5–$127.5 million. The company remains focused on building dynamic platforms to help businesses connect and grow in a complex marketplace.

Original SEC Filing: Emerald Holding, Inc. [ EEX ] - 8-K - Oct. 31, 2025

Disclaimer
This is an AI-powered summary. It may contain inaccuracies. Consider verifying important information with the source. Please note this summary is solely based on documents filed with the SEC.

data.title: Aon Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
data.description:
Aon plc, a leading global professional services firm, has released its financial results for the third quarter of 2025. The company reported robust performance metrics, reflecting its continued execution of the Aon United strategy and the 3x3 Plan aimed at meeting client demand and driving sustainable growth.

Financial Highlights

For the three months ended September 30, 2025, Aon reported a 7% increase in total revenue, reaching $4.0 billion compared to $3.7 billion in the same period last year. Organic revenue growth also stood at 7%. Operating income saw a significant rise of 31% to $816 million, while adjusted operating income increased by 15% to $1.05 billion. The operating margin improved to 20.4%, up from 16.7% in the prior year period, and the adjusted operating margin rose to 26.3% from 24.6%.

Business and Operational Highlights

Risk Capital revenue increased by 7% to $2.5 billion, driven by strong growth in North America and EMEA, particularly in core P&C, M&A services, and construction. Human Capital revenue grew by 8% to $1.5 billion, with notable performance in Health Solutions and Wealth Solutions segments.

Operating expenses increased by 3% to $3.2 billion, primarily due to higher compensation and benefits expenses associated with organic revenue growth and the impact of foreign currency translation. However, these were partially offset by savings from the Accelerating Aon United restructuring actions.

Strategic Initiatives and Corporate Developments

Aon repurchased 0.7 million class A ordinary shares for approximately $250 million during the third quarter, with $1.6 billion remaining under its share repurchase program as of September 30, 2025. The company continues to focus on scaling its data analytics capabilities and expanding in the middle market, unlocking new sources of capital.

Management's Perspective

Greg Case, President and CEO of Aon, highlighted the company's strong performance and strategic execution. "Our Aon United strategy, accelerated through our 3x3 Plan, is delivering strong results. We are attracting top talent in high-growth areas, scaling our data analytics across our core Risk Capital and Human Capital businesses, expanding in the middle market, and unlocking new sources of capital," said Case. He also emphasized the company's robust cash generation and disciplined portfolio management, which enable high-return investments and capital returns to shareholders.

Future Outlook

Aon remains confident in achieving its full-year 2025 financial targets and is well-positioned to deliver sustainable growth in 2026 and beyond. The company expects a de minimis impact on adjusted EPS for the full year 2025 if currency rates remain stable.

Original SEC Filing: Aon plc [ AON ] - 8-K - Oct. 31, 2025

data.title: Copper extends retreat on soggy Chinese factory data, stronger dollar
data.description:
By Eric Onstad

Copper prices extended losses on Friday, weighed down by weak industrial data in top metals consumer China, a firm dollar and profit-taking following a rally to a record peak.

Three-month copper on the London Metal Exchange was down 0.6% at $10,855 per metric ton by 1025 GMT, the second day of losses after touching a record high on Wednesday of $11,200.

LME copper has gained 5.7% so far this month, and is heading for a third straight monthly gain.

Data showed on Friday that China's factory activity shrank for a seventh month in October, dragged down by a drop in new export orders as the boost from months of front-loading to beat U.S. tariff threats finally wore off.

"Today's China data has weighed on the sentiment in the base metals complex," said Ewa Manthey, commodities strategist at ING.

"While near-term demand indicators remain mixed, supply disruptions will keep a floor under prices around the $10,000 per ton level," she added.

"However, to push that rally further, copper will also need to see strong demand growth, especially from China."

The most-traded copper contract on the Shanghai Futures Exchange eased 1.7% to 87,010 yuan ($12,215.36) a ton. It also was set for a third straight monthly gain, rising 4.8%.

Many Chinese buyers have been on the sidelines as prices rallied.

The Yangshan copper premium (SMM-CUYP-CN), which reflects demand for copper imported into China, has dropped 28% over the past month to $36 a ton.

Also pressuring the market was a slightly stronger dollar index , which was hovering near a three-month peak touched on Thursday. A firmer dollar makes greenback-denominated assets more expensive to holders of other currencies.

LME aluminium slipped 0.4% to $2,853 a ton after LME inventories (MALSTX-TOTAL) jumped by a fifth due to a 102,275-ton inflow to warehouses in Malaysia, LME data showed on Friday.

Among other metals, LME nickel edged down 0.1% to $15,210 a ton, zinc shed 0.3% to $3,028.50, lead eased 0.4% to $2,015, and tin added 0.2% to $35,870.

For the top stories in metals, click

($1 = 7.1230 Chinese yuan)

data.title: Allete 3Q EPS 46c >ALE
ALLETE, Inc. Awaits Written Order to Complete Sale to Partners Canada Pension Plan Investment Board and Global Infrastructure Partners; Reports Third Quarter 2025 Earnings
data.description:
(10:30 GMT) *Allete 3Q EPS 46c >ALE
(10:30 GMT) *Allete 3Q Net $27.1M >ALE
(10:30 GMT) *Allete 3Q Rev $375M >ALE
(10:30 GMT) Press Release: ALLETE, Inc. Awaits Written Order to Complete Sale to Partners Canada Pension Plan Investment Board and Global Infrastructure Partners; Reports Third Quarter 2025 Earnings

DULUTH, Minn.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--October 31, 2025--

ALLETE, Inc. ALLETE today reported third quarter 2025 earnings of 46 cents per share on net income of $27.1 million. Last year's third quarter results were 78 cents per share on net income of $45.0 million. Net income in the third quarter of 2025 and year to date primarily reflects lower sales to industrial customers and inflationary pressures at Minnesota Power, lower sales of renewable projects at the clean energy businesses and transaction related expenses.

ALLETE awaits a written order from the Minnesota Public Utilities Commission ("MPUC") in order to execute on the closing of the partnership with Canada Pension Plan Investment Board ("CPP Investments") and Global Infrastructure Partners ("GIP").

"I am grateful for the MPUC's unanimous approval of ALLETE's partnership with CPP Investments and GIP on October 3, 2025, and extremely proud of our entire ALLETE team for the thoughtful work with our many stakeholders throughout the regulatory process — all as they continue to work diligently to execute our Sustainability-in-Action strategy," said ALLETE Chair, President, and Chief Executive Officer Bethany Owen. "The MPUC's approval results in historic benefits for our customers, our employees, and the communities we serve. We expect to close the transaction once the written order is received from the MPUC, and we are excited for the next chapter of ALLETE's wonderful history with these Partners that are aligned with our values and support our culture and strategy."

ALLETE's Regulated Operations segment, which includes Minnesota Power, SWLP and the Company's investment in the American Transmission Company, recorded third quarter 2025 net income of $32.5 million, compared to $34.0 million in the third quarter a year ago. Net income at Minnesota Power was lower than 2024 reflecting lower margins from industrial customers, and higher operating and maintenance expense, partially offset by lower income tax expense and increased cost recovery rider revenue.

ALLETE Clean Energy recorded a third quarter 2025 net loss of $3.6 million compared to net income of $3.9 million in 2024. Net income in 2025 reflected lower production, along with associated tax credits, due to transmission network outages in the SPP market. Net income in the third quarter of 2024 reflected the sale of the Whitetail wind project.

New Energy Equity recorded 2025 third quarter net income of $1.3 million, compared to net income of $11.7 million for the same period in 2024. Net income in 2025 includes lower sales of renewable energy projects due to the timing of project closings. These decreases were partially offset by higher earnings from tax equity financed solar energy facilities and higher investment tax credits.

Corporate and Other businesses, which include BNI Energy, ALLETE Properties and our investments in renewable energy facilities, recorded a net loss of $3.1 million in the third quarter of 2025, compared to a net loss of $4.6 million in 2024. Net income in 2025 reflects lower merger-related expenses compared to 2024, and lower income tax expense. Merger-related expenses were $3.1 million after-tax in 2025 compared to $3.8 million in 2024.

"Results for 2025 have been negatively impacted by lower industrial margins as a result of lower sales to taconite customers at Minnesota Power which are expected to continue through the remainder of 2025," said ALLETE Vice President — Chief Financial Officer and Corporate Treasurer Jeff Scissons. "As a result of the transaction, historic customer, clean-energy, workforce and governance commitments have been made by our Partners. Approximately $200 million of value including rate credits, an immediate return on equity reduction and rate case stay-out provision will be recognized by Minnesota Power customers, while maintaining existing charitable and economic investments will benefit ALLETE stakeholders and our communities. The rate case stay-out provision will have an impact on 2026 financials, but it is a material benefit to all Minnesota Power customers."

ALLETE is an energy company headquartered in Duluth, Minn. In addition to its electric utilities, Minnesota Power and Superior Water, Light and Power of Wisconsin, ALLETE owns ALLETE Clean Energy, based in Duluth, BNI Energy in Bismarck, N.D., New Energy Equity in Annapolis, MD, and has an eight percent equity interest in the American Transmission Co. More information about ALLETE is available at www.allete.com. ALE-CORP

The statements contained in this release and statements that ALLETE may make orally in connection with this release that are not historical facts, are forward-looking statements. Actual results may differ materially from those projected in the forward-looking statements. These forward-looking statements involve risks and uncertainties and investors are directed to the risks discussed in documents filed by ALLETE with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

ALLETE's press releases and other communications may include certain non-Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) financial measures. A "non-GAAP financial measure" is defined as a numerical measure of a company's financial performance, financial position or cash flows that excludes (or includes) amounts that are included in (or excluded from) the most directly comparable measure calculated and presented in accordance with GAAP in the company's financial statements.

Non-GAAP financial measures utilized by the Company include presentations of earnings (loss) per share. ALLETE's management believes that these non-GAAP financial measures provide useful information to investors by removing the effect of variances in GAAP reported results of operations that are not indicative of changes in the fundamental earnings power of the Company's operations. Management believes that the presentation of the non-GAAP financial measures is appropriate and enables investors and analysts to more accurately compare the company's ongoing financial performance over the periods presented.

data.title: FIH Mobile Says Chih Yu Yang Retired As Executive Director, Chairman
data.description:
FIH Mobile Ltd :

  • CHIH YU YANG HAS RETIRED AS AN EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, CHAIRMAN

  • HUANG YING SHIH APPOINTED AS CHAIRMAN OF BOARD
